docs.title: VoiceAssist Documentation Style Guide
docs.summary: Writing standards for VoiceAssist documentation

docs.title: Feature Flags Overview
docs.summary: Comprehensive guide to VoiceAssist feature flag system
docs.aiSummary: Feature flags enable runtime feature toggling without deployments. Use category.feature_name pattern (e.g., ui.dark_mode, backend.rag_strategy). Flags stored in PostgreSQL, cached in Redis (5min TTL).

docs.title: Feature Flags Admin Panel Guide
docs.summary: Using the Admin Panel to manage feature flags
docs.aiSummary: Admin Panel at admin.asimo.io provides UI for flag management. Navigate to Settings > Feature Flags. Toggle, edit percentage, filter by category. Real-time updates via SSE. Requires admin JWT.

docs.title: Advanced Feature Flag Types
docs.summary: Boolean, percentage, variant, and scheduled feature flag types
docs.aiSummary: Four flag types available - boolean (on/off), percentage (gradual rollout 0-100%), variant (A/B/C testing), scheduled (time-based activation). Use percentage for safe rollouts, variant for A/B tests.

docs.title: Feature Flag Best Practices
docs.summary: Guidelines for effective feature flag usage
docs.aiSummary: Keep flags temporary (remove after stable rollout). Use descriptive names. Start with 10% rollouts. Always have rollback plan. Review flags quarterly. Document in code and commit messages.

docs.title: Feature Flag Lifecycle
docs.summary: Managing feature flags from creation to retirement
docs.aiSummary: Flags go through 4 stages - creation (disabled), testing (dev/staging), rollout (gradual %), retirement (cleanup). Always start disabled, test in non-prod, use percentage rollouts, clean up after 100% stable.

docs.title: Multi-Environment Feature Flags
docs.summary: Managing feature flags across dev, staging, and production environments
docs.aiSummary: Flags have per-environment states. Dev flags auto-enable, staging mirrors prod with overrides, prod requires explicit enablement. Use Redis namespaced keys (flags:dev:name, flags:prod:name).

docs.title: Feature Flag Naming Conventions
docs.summary: Standards for naming feature flags in VoiceAssist
docs.aiSummary: Use category.feature_name pattern. Categories are ui, backend, admin, integration, experiment, ops. Use snake_case for feature names. Never use hyphens or the deprecated ff_ prefix.

docs.title: System Settings vs Feature Flags
docs.summary: Understanding when to use configuration settings vs feature flags
docs.aiSummary: Use system settings for permanent config (API_TIMEOUT, DATABASE_URL). Use feature flags for temporary toggles (new features, A/B tests, gradual rollouts). Settings need deployment to change; flags change at runtime.
